job_title: VP of Operations in Las Vegas, NV
pros: - NCC treats us like family - Plenty of room for Professional Growth - Multiple employee training to support your professional growth - NCC does a great job of promoting diversity and inclusion
cons: I cannot think of one reason why NCC is not the best workplace.

job_title: Medical Assistant Instructor in Las Vegas, NV
pros: It is a positive environment and you are encouraged to have a good time. Great coworkers and great bosses. I've had absolute terrible employers/managers in the past. NCC might not be perfect but they come closer than most. Biannual raises and reviews. A new 401k was just implemented.
cons: Insurance could be better and more affordable. It's expensive on its own for 1 person. Have a family? Forget about insuring them through NCC. I had looked it up and for a family plan, it would cost half my monthly pay. Nope. In addition, while most management is great in the faculty side of things, there have been times when issues or problems have been swept under the rug. It doesn't happen often but it does happen. Not really a con in my book but just as a warning to future employees. They have a very strict policy on fraternization. They will 100% terminate you for violating that policy.

job_title: Training and Development Coordinator in Las Vegas, NV
pros: This company has given me great job security. The company is growing. Therefore, there is much opportunity for growth should individuals work to get there. While the company is growing, approaching 200 employees, the business owners put their best foot forward in making this company feel like family. People are very friendly, and this is an expectation. To treat everyone with respect. This is something I can stand behind! The compensation is fair and competitive.
cons: Very fast paste! Keep in mind NCC is a growing company. There are new programs being added, more people to employees, and student management. Therefore, naturally, there are often new policies that come into play. Change is constant. The management team is supportive of new changes, but they happen, and they happen often.

job_title: Faculty in Las Vegas, NV

Work at your own pace- of course, this is a fast pace environment. Provides you with resources and tools to do your job. No micromanagement. great Water machine !!! Opportunity for compensation increases as you increase your knowledge.
cons: Not really a Con but with the parking, So many great employees and not enough parking spaces up front lol.

job_title: Admissions Specialist in Las Vegas, NV
pros: There are no good things I can say about this place.
cons: It is owned by a family and they are HR. No privacy of what you talk to them about. Super micromanagement. They will blame you for anything and everything even if it isn't your fault. Favoritism is big with management. Sometimes it isn't clear why they like someone else over you. If you are a favorite you're good. But if you aren't they will find any reason to write you up until they can let you go. For example they will write you up for having a slow week eventhough in admissions you inevitably have slower weeks than others. Do not share anything personal with your manager. If you aren't a favorite they will manipulate the personal things you have told them to force you to quit. Management will isolate you from the rest of your coworkers to bully you further. They are deceptively nice in the beginning but don't fall for it. They will be your best friend until they stab you in the back. Benefits are horrible. Just PTO so when you get sick you have to use time that could have been vacation and it accumulates so slowly. Health insurance is super expensive. Also if you call out you get a point. If you get 4 then you get written up. Do not work for these people.
